pageTitle: Patent US4754680 - Overdubbing apparatus for electronic musical instrument - Google Patents
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {33829=Copending U.S. patent applications Ser. Nos. 760,290 and 760,291 both filed July 29, 1985 and assigned to the same assignee as this application disclose a musical instrument of such a type as described above. The '290 application issued as U.S. Pat. No. 4,681,008 on July 21, 1987, and the '291 application issued as U.S. Pat. No. 4,667,556 on May 26, 1987.}
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations In summary, according to the invention it is possible to provide an overdubbing apparatus for an electronic musical instrument, which is convenient to use, has high operability and provides pleasant musical effects. Furthermore, while in the above embodiment only the tone volume is displayed, it is also possible to provide a display concerning a timbre, e.g., a filter cut-off frequency, which will be more convenient to the performer. Further, in the above embodiment the tone number of the tone to be overdubbed is indicated by display elements 41a to 44a which are provided separately of display unit 48. However, it is possible to display such data on a single display unit. Further, only particular channels among a plurality of channels may be made exclusive write channels for only writing waveform signal in waveform memory 7, while the other channels are made exclusive read channels for only reading out waveform signal form waveform memory 7. The "waveform read/write channel" according to the invention means a channel which is capable of both read and write operations or only either read or write operation. Further, in the above embodiment the tone generation control unit 8 is provided with a plurality of waveform read/write channels constructed by a time division arrangement. However, it is also possible to provide a plurality of waveform read/write channels by using separate hardware of like circuit construction for each channel. Further, in the above embodiment
